format: A data frame with 200 observations on the following 22 variables.
reference: Patient ID numbers are the rownames of the data frame.
description:
Description
The ICU data set consists of a sample of 200 subjects who were part of
a much larger study on survival of patients following admission to an adult
intensive care unit (ICU), derived from  
Hosmer, Lemeshow and Sturdivant (2013) and Friendly (2000).
The major goal of this study was to develop a
logistic regression model to predict the probability of survival to hospital
discharge of these patients and to study the risk factors associated with 
ICU mortality. The clinical details of the study are described in 
Lemeshow, Teres, Avrunin, and Pastides (1988).
This data set is often used to illustrate model selection methods for
logistic regression.
title: ICU data set

parameters.infect: Infection probable at ICU admission?, a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.white: a recoding of race,  a factor with levels White Non-white
parameters.hrtrate: Heart rate at ICU Admission (beats/min), a numeric vector
parameters.pco: PCO2 from initial blood gases, a factor with levels <=45 >45
parameters.renal: History of chronic renal failure?, a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.sex: Patient sex, a factor with levels Female Male
parameters.cpr: Patient received CPR prior to ICU admission?, a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.systolic: Systolic blood pressure at admission (mm Hg), a numeric vector
parameters.previcu: Previous admission to an ICU within 6 Months?, a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.coma: Level of unconsciousness at admission to ICU,	a factor with levels None Stupor Coma
parameters.creatin: Creatinine, from initial blood gases, a factor with levels <=2 >2
parameters.race: Patient race, a factor with levels Black Other White.  Also represented here as white.
parameters.uncons: a recoding of coma a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.po2: PO2 from initial blood gases, a factor with levels >60 <=60
parameters.admit: Type of admission, a factor with levels Elective Emergency
parameters.ph: pH from initial blood gases, a factor with levels >=7.25 <7.25
parameters.bic: Bicarbonate (HCO3) level from initial blood gases, a factor with levels >=18 <18
parameters.service: Service at ICU Admission, a factor with levels Medical Surgical
parameters.fracture:
Admission with a long bone, multiple, neck, single area, or hip fracture?
a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.died: Died before discharge?, a factor with levels No Yes
parameters.cancer: Cancer part of present problem?, a factor with levels No Yes
